section.title: Authors
section.para: The Java Service Wrapper is currently maintained and actively developed by Leif Mortenson, who originally created a basic version of the Wrapper exclusively for the Windows platform.
Ryan Shaw was responsible for originally porting the Wrapper to the Linux, and then Solaris platforms, which was a major task at the time.
Johan Sorlin contributed much of the current logging system.
Many others have also contributed code over the years. I have tried to mention everyone in the release notes, but many have helped with testing, to patches, to finding and reporting bugs, etc.

section.title: Releases
section.para: Several of the platforms that we are able to support and release in binary form would not be possible without the hard work of the following Wrapper users who donate their time every time we do a release to test their platforms and then provide the binary releases.
